hook_line: Technical execution only matters when it translates into business credibility.
linkedin_post:
Most developers build projects. Few position them strategically.

This project addresses a common gap: technical work often lacks business framing. Instead of merely documenting features, I designed an automation pipeline that converts raw GitHub READMEs into recruiter-ready narratives.

The system ingests documentation, cleans unstructured text, and applies schema-enforced AI generation to produce structured content across LinkedIn, Twitter, resumes, and portfolio summaries.

Rather than listing tools, the approach emphasizes problem framing, decision impact, and analytical thinking.

By integrating API orchestration, data transformation, and structured prompt engineering, I created a repeatable positioning engine.

The result is not just automation — it’s a scalable method to convert technical work into professional capital.

How do you currently communicate the business value behind your projects?
